titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco Musical Works PASC-M.0117
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Special Collections staff.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.p: This record is made available under an Universal 1.0 Public Domain Dedication Creative Commons license.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2025-07-31 14:18:23 -0700.

did.unittitle: Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco musical works
did.abstract: This collection consists of published scores and reproductions of manuscripts
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: Materials are in English and Italian.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mario Castelnuovo-Tedesco Musical Works (Collection PASC-M 117). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Performing Arts Special Collections staff.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's library collections and archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of published scores and reproductions of manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Poem by Juan Ramon Jimenes. Various dates, from June 12, 1960 to July 21, 1960. First series: 1. Platero; 2. Angelus; 3. Retorno; 4. La Primavera; 5. El Pozo; 6. Gorriones; 7. Melancolia. Second series: 1. Amistad; 2. La Luna; 3. Juegos del Anochecer; 4. Ronsard; 5. El Loco; 6. La Tisica; 7. Nostalgia. Third series: 1. Mariposa Blancas; 2. Idilio de Abril; 3. El Canario Vuela; 4. La Arrulladora; 5. El Canario se Muere; 6. Idilio de Noviembre; 7. La Muerte. Fourth series: 1. Convalecencia; 2. Golondrinas; 3. La Flor del Camino; 4. Domingo; 5. Los Gitanos; 6. Carnaval; 7. A Platero en Cielo de Moguer. For solo guitar.

did.unittitle: Il Bestiario : dodici poesie di Arturo Loria per canto e pianoforte, op. 188. Ozalid copy of autograph ms. (Beverly Hills, Calif., April 20, 1960). 45p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Text by Arturo Loria. For voice and piano. 1. Le Columbe; 2. Il Gufo; 3. Il Lombrico; 4. Il Moscon d'oro; 5. Il Muscoli; 6. Il Pipistrello; 7. Il Tarlo; 8. La Cicak; 9. La Marmotta; 10. Le Rane; 11. Le Rondini; 12. La Lucciola.

did.unittitle: Leaves of Grass. Ozalid copy of autograph ms. (15-30 Giugno [June], 1936). 35p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1. What think you I take my pen in hand?; 2. I dream'd in a dream; 3. Sometimes with one I love; 4. We two boys together clinging; 5. Are you the new person drawn toward me?; 6. When I peruse the conquer'd fame; 7. A glimpse; 8. This moment, yearning and thoughtful; 9. Trickle, drops!; 10. The base of all metaphysics. For voice and piano.
